2 Kings or 4 Kings__19.23__Carmel: A pleasant fruitful hill in the forest. These expressions are figurative, signifying under the names of mountains and forests, the kings and provinces whom the Assyrians had triumphed over.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__19.25__I have formed it: All thy exploits, in which thou takest pride, are no more than what I have decreed; and are not to be ascribed to thy wisdom or strength, but to my will and ordinancewho have given to thee to take and destroy so many fenced cities, and to carry terror wherever thou comest.-- Ibid.
